intro: Zeugites mexicanus var. glandulosus, commonly known as the Mexican zeugite, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
